news_header: Google will update its Maps to show 'Gulf of America' and 'Mount McKinley' when official changes are made by the US government.
news_original_title: 'Gulf of America': How Google Maps handles controversial geography
news_text: Google announced that it will display the names 'Gulf of America' and 'Mount McKinley' on its Maps for US users once the US government officially renames these locations, as pledged by President Trump. The Gulf of Mexico will be renamed to the Gulf of America, and Mount McKinley will revert to its original name, Denali. Google stated it follows official government updates and will quickly reflect these changes in its service. Users in the US will see the new names, while users in Mexico will still see the old names. Google has a history of navigating naming disputes by displaying different names based on user location.
